title: Champs CR host Navy SC in curtain raiser
byline: The Clifford Cup knockout rugby tournament will get underway today in Colombo with two important quarter-final encounters scheduled to be played simultaneously at 4 pm as the top eight clubs battle for a place in the semi-finals at one of Sri Lanka’s most prestigious rugby competitions.

title: Pakistan PM says can ’crush’ aggressors after Afghan strikes
byline: Pakistan’s Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif said on Friday his country’s armed forces can ’’crush’’ aggressors, following air strikes on neighbouring Afghanistan.

title: Over 80% state university graduates are migrating
byline: Sri Lanka is undergoing a brain drain crisis where a new study from the University of Peradeniya reveals that over 50 per cent of state university graduates, rising to 80-90 per cent in critical fields like medicine, engineering, and agriculture, are migrating permanently, never to return, according to a recent article by Ceylon Public Affairs.

title: Netflix drops bid for Warner Bros, clearing way for Paramount takeover
byline: Netflix has backed away from its proposal to buy Warner Bros Discovery, clearing the way for Paramount Skydance to win a months-long battle for one of Hollywood’s most storied studios.

title: Finance Ministry tables fresh tax hikes
byline: The Government has tabled sweeping changes to Sri Lanka’s tax framework, proposing higher taxes on capital gains, a wider net for withholding tax and a one-off relief window for those with unpaid dues.

title: Pakistan strikes Afghan cities as cross-border attacks escalate
byline: Pakistan launched strikes on the Afghan cities of Kabul and Kandahar in the early hours of Friday, according to Pakistani government officials.

title: ‘Podi Lassie’  brought back to Sri Lanka
byline: Organised criminal and alleged drug trafficker Arumahandi Janith Madusankha de Silva, alias ‘Podi Lassie’, was brought back to Sri Lanka from India early this morning (27) by a special police team.

title: Sri Lanka can win again, says Malinga in emotional post
byline: Former Sri Lanka fast-bowling legend Lasith Malinga has called on cricket fans to remain patient and continue supporting the national team, insisting that another ICC World Cup triumph is within reach.

title: Rinku Singh’s father passes away after cancer battle
byline: Grief has struck Indian cricketer Rinku Singh as his father, Khachandra Singh, passed away at a hospital in Greater Noida after battling stage 4 liver cancer.

title: T20 Semis Race: Who can still qualify?
byline: The Super 8 stage of the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup is entering a crucial phase. Two semi-final spots are locked, but two more remain up for grabs — and the battle is on.

title: India thrash Zimbabwe in T20 World Cup, S.Africa into semi-finals
byline: Defending champions India thrashed Zimbabwe by 72 runs in their Super Eights T20 World Cup match on Thursday, a result that guaranteed South Africa a place in the semi-finals.

title: GMOA announces series of island-wide professional actions
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has decided to launch a series of island-wide professional actions, alleging that the government has failed to honour written agreements aimed at resolving longstanding issues affecting doctors and the public health system.

title: Nearly 4,700 displaced still in safety centres after Cyclone Ditwah
byline: Sri Lanka continues to grapple with the aftermath of Cyclone Ditwah, with nearly 4,700 people still living in temporary safety centres following severe flooding and landslides, according to a recent assessment by the Shelter, Land and Site Coordination Sector.

title: WhatsApp Web login glitch hits iPhone users, service stable for Android
byline: Many users reported issues accessing WhatsApp Web on Friday morning, with complaints largely centred around difficulties logging in and syncing chats.

title: AASL calls bids for ads at BIA terminal 01
byline: Airport and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) (Private) Limited (AASL) has invited National Competitive Bids for advertising opportunities at Passenger Terminal 01 of Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), offering brands a platform at the country’s premier international gateway.

title: BIA launches Digital Nomad Visa facility
byline: Sri Lanka officially launched its long-anticipated Digital Nomad Visa (DNV) programme at the “Silk Route” passenger terminal of Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake, positioning the country as a destination for remote professionals seeking long-term stays.

title: 2025 A/L practical exams schedule announced
byline: The Examinations Department has announced the schedule for the practical tests of the 2025 General Certificate of Education (Advanced Level) Examination.

title: World Economic Forum boss quits after review of Epstein links
byline: The president and CEO of the World Economic Forum (WEF), Borge Brende, has resigned after a review into his links to the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Validity of footwear gift vouchers for school students extended
byline: The validity period of the footwear gift voucher programme for selected school students has been extended.

title: Lunar eclipse to be visible in Sri Lanka on March 3
byline: Sri Lankans will have the opportunity to witness a lunar eclipse on Tuesday, March 3, 2026, the Arthur C Clarke Institute for Modern Technologies said.

title: Actor-Politician Vijay’s wife files for divorce
byline: Actor-politician Vijay’s wife Sangeetha Sornalingam has filed for divorce in a court in Chengalpattu, Tamil Nadu. Sangeetha wants the marriage dissolved.

title: Chelsea to face holders PSG in Champions League’s last 16
byline: Chelsea will play holders Paris St-Germain in the Champions League round of 16 while Manchester City will face Real Madrid in the knockout stages for a fifth straight season.

title: Salam Ramadan 2026 kicks off in Colombo
byline: Salam Ramadan kicked off this evening at Green Path, Colombo, celebrating unity, compassion and shared heritage.
